name: Brahim BANKS, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Banks v. Court of Common Pleas of Philadelphia County

pin_cites.parenthetical: explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted
explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted

parties: Brahim BANKS, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 23rd day of March, 2016, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Ali, 608 Pa. 71, 10 A.3d 282 (2010) (explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted). The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
133 A.3d 736
Brahim BANKS, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent.
No. 16 EM 2016.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
March 23, 2016.
